properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 2 at 2:01PM MST until March 4 at 12:00PM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOWS FOR MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS
ABOVE 7,000 FEET TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...

An upper level low tracking across the region will bring a
prolonged period of lowland rains and mountain snows to the
Borderland beginning Tuesday morning and ending Wednesday
evening. The heaviest snowfall is expected over the Sacramento
Mountains as snow showers become heavy through the night Tuesday
into Wednesday. New snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches will be
possible for locations above 8000 feet. 2 to 6 inches of snow will
be possible along the east slopes of the Sacramento Mountains.
Further west, snowfall over the Black Range will produce 6 to 8
inches of new snow. Snowfall will end Wednesday morning over the
Black Range, then Wednesday evening over the Sacramento Mountains.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to
18 inches above 8000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches between 7000 and 8000 feet.

* WHERE...Portions of Otero County New Mexico above 7500 feet
ASL.

* WHEN...From 5 AM Tuesday to noon MST Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow rates are expected to
occur Tuesday evening into the overnight hours as a band of
heavier precipitation passes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico obtained by calling
5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO NOON MST WEDNESDAY
